title: Emperor Antoninus Pius dies and is succeeded by his adoptive sons Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus.
text: Emperor Antoninus Pius dies and is succeeded by his adoptive sons Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus.

title: Roman subjects in the province of Africa revolt against Maximinus Thrax and elect Gordian I as emperor.
text: Roman subjects in the province of Africa revolt against Maximinus Thrax and elect Gordian I as emperor.

title: Emperor Constantine I decrees that the dies Solis Invicti (sun-day) is the day of rest in the Empire.
text: Emperor Constantine I decrees that the dies Solis Invicti (sun-day) is the day of rest in the Empire.

title: Stephen Tempier, bishop of Paris, condemns 219 philosophical and theological theses.
text: Stephen Tempier, bishop of Paris, condemns 219 philosophical and theological theses.

title: A peace treaty is signed between the Ottoman Empire and the Republic of Venice, ending the Ottoman–Venetian War and leaving Cyprus in Ottoman hands.
text: A peace treaty is signed between the Ottoman Empire and the Republic of Venice, ending the Ottoman–Venetian War and leaving Cyprus in Ottoman hands.

title: Napoleon Bonaparte captures Jaffa in Palestine and his troops proceed to kill more than 2,000 Albanian captives.
text: Napoleon Bonaparte captures Jaffa in Palestine and his troops proceed to kill more than 2,000 Albanian captives.

title: Emperor Napoleon I of France wins the Battle of Craonne.
text: Emperor Napoleon I of France wins the Battle of Craonne.

title: Brazilian marines unsuccessfully attack the temporary naval base of Carmen de Patagones, Argentina.
text: Brazilian marines unsuccessfully attack the temporary naval base of Carmen de Patagones, Argentina.

title: Shrigley abduction: Ellen Turner is abducted by Edward Gibbon Wakefield, a future politician in colonial New Zealand.
text: Shrigley abduction: Ellen Turner is abducted by Edward Gibbon Wakefield, a future politician in colonial New Zealand.

title: Senator Daniel Webster gives his "Seventh of March" speech endorsing the Compromise of 1850 in order to prevent a possible civil war.
text: Senator Daniel Webster gives his "Seventh of March" speech endorsing the Compromise of 1850 in order to prevent a possible civil war.

title: American Civil War: Union forces engage Confederate troops at the Pea Ridge in northwestern Arkansas.
text: American Civil War: Union forces engage Confederate troops at the Pea Ridge in northwestern Arkansas.

title: Alexander Graham Bell is granted a patent for an invention he calls the "telephone".
text: Alexander Graham Bell is granted a patent for an invention he calls the "telephone".

title: The German liner SS Kaiser Wilhelm der Grosse becomes the first ship to send wireless signals to shore.
text: The German liner SS Kaiser Wilhelm der Grosse becomes the first ship to send wireless signals to shore.

title: Second Boer War: Boers, led by Koos de la Rey, inflict the biggest defeat upon the British since the beginning of the war, at Tweebosch.
text: Second Boer War: Boers, led by Koos de la Rey, inflict the biggest defeat upon the British since the beginning of the war, at Tweebosch.

title: Prince William of Wied arrives in Albania to begin his reign as King.
text: Prince William of Wied arrives in Albania to begin his reign as King.

title: Prelude to World War II: In violation of the Locarno Pact and the Treaty of Versailles, Germany reoccupies the Rhineland.
text: Prelude to World War II: In violation of the Locarno Pact and the Treaty of Versailles, Germany reoccupies the Rhineland.

title: World War II: American troops seize the Ludendorff Bridge over the Rhine river at Remagen.
text: World War II: American troops seize the Ludendorff Bridge over the Rhine river at Remagen.

title: Cold War: The Soviet Union issues a statement denying that Klaus Fuchs served as a Soviet spy.
text: Cold War: The Soviet Union issues a statement denying that Klaus Fuchs served as a Soviet spy.

title: Korean War: Operation Ripper: United Nations troops led by General Matthew Ridgway begin an assault against Chinese forces.
text: Korean War: Operation Ripper: United Nations troops led by General Matthew Ridgway begin an assault against Chinese forces.

title: Bloody Sunday: A group of 600 civil rights marchers is brutally attacked by state and local police in Selma, Alabama.
text: Bloody Sunday: A group of 600 civil rights marchers is brutally attacked by state and local police in Selma, Alabama.

title: The Majelis Permusyawaratan Rakyat Sementara (MPRS), Indonesia's provisional parliament, revoked Sukarno's mandate as President of Indonesia.
text: The Majelis Permusyawaratan Rakyat Sementara (MPRS), Indonesia's provisional parliament, revoked Sukarno's mandate as President of Indonesia.

title: Vietnam War: The United States and South Vietnamese military begin Operation Truong Cong Dinh to root out Viet Cong forces from the area surrounding Mỹ Tho.
text: Vietnam War: The United States and South Vietnamese military begin Operation Truong Cong Dinh to root out Viet Cong forces from the area surrounding Mỹ Tho.

title: Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, political leader of then East Pakistan (present day-Bangladesh), delivers his historic 7th March speech in the Racecourse Field (Now Suhrawardy Udyan) in Dhaka.
text: Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, political leader of then East Pakistan (present day-Bangladesh), delivers his historic 7th March speech in the Racecourse Field (Now Suhrawardy Udyan) in Dhaka.

title: Challenger Disaster: Divers from the USS Preserver locate the crew cabin of Challenger on the ocean floor.
text: Challenger Disaster: Divers from the USS Preserver locate the crew cabin of Challenger on the ocean floor.

title: Lieyu massacre: Taiwanese military massacre of 19 unarmed Vietnamese refugees at Donggang, Lieyu, Kinmen.
text: Lieyu massacre: Taiwanese military massacre of 19 unarmed Vietnamese refugees at Donggang, Lieyu, Kinmen.

title: Iran and the United Kingdom break diplomatic relations after a fight over Salman Rushdie and his controversial novel, The Satanic Verses.
text: Iran and the United Kingdom break diplomatic relations after a fight over Salman Rushdie and his controversial novel, The Satanic Verses.

title: The tugboat Thomas Hebert sank off the coast of New Jersey, USA.
text: The tugboat Thomas Hebert sank off the coast of New Jersey, USA.

title: The terrorist organisation Lashkar-e-Taiba coordinates a series of bombings in Varanasi, India.
text: The terrorist organisation Lashkar-e-Taiba coordinates a series of bombings in Varanasi, India.

title: The British House of Commons votes to make the upper chamber, the House of Lords, 100% elected.
text: The British House of Commons votes to make the upper chamber, the House of Lords, 100% elected.

title: The Real Irish Republican Army kills two British soldiers and injures two other soldiers and two civilians at Massereene Barracks, the first British military deaths in Northern Ireland since the end of The Troubles.
text: The Real Irish Republican Army kills two British soldiers and injures two other soldiers and two civilians at Massereene Barracks, the first British military deaths in Northern Ireland since the end of The Troubles.
